content.description: Two beautiful traditional climbs separated by a large ledge that can be linked up as a little multi-pitch adventure. Fun, well protected, moderate climbing with great summit views of Lake Superior and all the peaks of 550.Pitch 1: Climb the jagged, right angling crack. Big feature climbing with crack protection and comfortable stances. A beautiful line. Anchor off the Red Pine just left of the top out. 50' 5.5.Pitch 2: From the top of pitch 1, walk right about 30' to the dihedral crack system with several stepped overhangs. A little more technical and airy than pitch 1, some smaller holds, stemming, and a few mantles will bring you to a bolted anchor at the top. Big thanks to Brandon Snyder for installing the bolts and saving many future anchor building headaches 50' 5.6.
content.location: The only cleaned part of the wall.

content.description: Two tall, slabby outcrops stacked on top of each other on the north side of the Sand Lot ridge.
